main event: A fiery red object was sighted in Bark River, Michigan, on 27 February 1961, observed via ground and air intercept radar.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 30 minutes., The object was described as being fiery red and similar to flames., No air intercept attempt was made as further identification was deemed impossible., The object was seen to dip behind some trees after being observed moving slowly northward., Witnesses included a housewife and her daughter, who confirmed the sighting together.
sighted object: fiery red object in the sky
